subject: Psychology
title: Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs
description: A quick win: understand Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs.

hook.text: A starving person doesn't think about self-expression. Maslow said you must meet basic needs before higher ones.

buildup.text: Abraham Maslow proposed a hierarchy: physiological, safety, belonging, esteem, and self-actualization.

discovery.text: Self-actualization â€” becoming the best version of yourself â€” sits at the top, achievable only when lower needs are met.

twist.text: Research hasn't strongly supported the strict hierarchy. People pursue meaning even in poverty and danger.

climax.text: The hierarchy is more of a useful framework than a scientific law â€” influential in business, education, and therapy.

punchline.text: Feed the body first. Then feed the soul.
